intro: Primula meiotera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters, with lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
